title.native: ドラゴンボール超 スーパーヒーロー

description:
The Red Ribbon Army was once destroyed by Son Goku. Individuals, who carry on its spirit, have created the ultimate Androids, Gamma 1 and Gamma 2. These two Androids call themselves "Super Heroes". They start attacking Piccolo and Gohan…What is the New Red Ribbon Army's objective? In the face of approaching danger, it is time to awaken, Super Hero!

(Source: Crunchyroll)

tags.name: Superhero
tags.description: Prominently features super-powered humans who aim to serve the greater good.

tags.name: Super Power
tags.description: Prominently features characters with special abilities that allow them to do what would normally be physically or logically impossible.

tags.name: Full CGI
tags.description: Almost entirely created with computer-generated imagery.

tags.name: Henshin
tags.description: Prominently features character or costume transformations which often grant special abilities.

tags.name: Cyborg
tags.description: Prominently features a human character whose physiological functions are aided or enhanced by artificial means.

tags.name: Martial Arts
tags.description: Centers around the use of traditional hand-to-hand combat.

tags.name: Shounen
tags.description: Target demographic is teenage and young adult males.

tags.name: CGI
tags.description: Prominently features scenes created with computer-generated imagery.

tags.name: Primarily Male Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of male characters.

tags.name: Primarily Adult Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of characters above a high school age.

tags.name: Urban Fantasy
tags.description: Set in a world similar to the real world, but with the existence of magic or other supernatural elements.

tags.name: Urban
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a city.

tags.name: Artificial Intelligence
tags.description: Intelligent non-organic machines that work and react similarly to humans.

tags.name: Tokusatsu
tags.description: Prominently features elements that resemble special effects in Japanese live-action shows

tags.name: Dragons
tags.description: Prominently features mythical reptiles which generally have wings and can breathe fire.

tags.name: Battle Royale
tags.description: Centers around a fierce group competition, often violent and with only one winner.

tags.name: Alternate Universe
tags.description: Features multiple alternate universes in the same series.

title.native: ドラゴンボール超 ブロリー
劇場版 ドラゴンボール超 スーパーヒーロー
ドラゴンボール超

node.description:
He debuted in 1979 with the story [Wonder Island](https://anilist.co/manga/112596/Wonder-Island/), published in Weekly Shounen Jump, and first gained popularity for the anime and manga series [Dr. Slump](https://anilist.co/manga/30796/Dr-Slump/), originally serialized weekly in Shounen Jump from 1980 to 1984. In 1982, he won the Shogakukan Manga Award for Dr. Slump for best shounen or shoujo manga series of the year.  In 1984, Toriyama was responsible for developing [Dragon Ball](https://anilist.co/manga/30042/Dragon-Ball/) which was initially serialized in Weekly Shōnen Jump. It became an instant accomplishment—primarily selling over 35,000,000 copies in Japan, Dragon Ball eventually became a record-breaking best seller with over 120,000,000 copies sold. Aside from the Japanese fame, the series was equally successful internationally as well, including in Europe (1988), Canada (1996) and Latin America. Its success encouraged Toriyama to continue working on Dragon Ball from 1984 to 1995. During that eleven-year period, he produced 519 chapters, collected into 42 volumes. Each volume has an average of 200 pages. Moreover, the benefit of the manga led to three anime adaptations, numerous feature-length animated movies, several video games, and mega-merchandising. Toriyama's studio is called "Bird Studio", which is a play on his name, "tori" meaning "bird."

Toriyama married his wife [Yoshimi Kato](https://anilist.co/staff/311142/Nachi-Mikami) on May 2, 1982. She is a former manga artist from Nagoya under the pen name "Nachi Mikami" and occasionally helped Toriyama and his assistant on Dr. Slump when they were short on time. Together with his wife, he had two children: a son born in 1987, and a daughter born in 1990. He was a well-known recluse, who avoided appearing in public or media.

On March 8, 2024, it was announced that Toriyama passed away at the age of 68 from acute subdural hematoma.

Tetsurou Kodama is a director, computer graphics director and background artist. According to him, it was [Cannon Fodder](https://anilist.co/anime/1462/Memories/), a movie by [Katsuhiro Ootomo](https://anilist.co/staff/96872) that was a part of Memories movie anthology, that inspired him to start making anime. He was awarded several prizes for the original short animated movies such as "My Home" and "Running Man". Currently, he is the representative director of studio Echoes, and he engages in various projects for creating TV animation, previews and commercials.
Currently an Executive Producer at MAPPA. Formerly at Toei Animation.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/naokisato_face) | [Spotify](https://open.spotify.com/artist/1hlpldRj6GZ2naD4XDqi80)

Naoki Sato is a Japanese composer and producer who has provided the music for several popular anime series. He was born on May 2, 1970 and graduated in Chiba Prefecture and Tokyo College of Music. At the 29th Japanese Academy Awards in 2006, he won the Best Music prize for his work on the film Always Sanchōme no Yuhi.

Wendel Luís Bezerra da Silva is a Brazilian actor, voice actor, dubbing director, announcer and YouTuber, in the field since he was eight years old. He also directs the dubbing of series and movies. He has four brothers, two of whom also pursue a career as a voice actor, Ulisses and Úrsula Bezerra.

[Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/dariusz.kosmowski) | [Linkedin](https://www.linkedin.com/in/dariusz-kosmowski/) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/@dubdaru)

Manager of the dubbing studio [Studio PDK](http://studiopdk.pl/). Founder, editor-and-chief, and webmaster of [Dubbingpedia.pl](https://dubbingpedia.pl/wiki/Strona_g%C5%82%C3%B3wna). Worked as project manager at the Polish anime distributor Anime Eden from 2014 until 2018.

[Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/dariusz.kosmowski) | [Linkedin](https://www.linkedin.com/in/dariusz-kosmowski/) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/@dubdaru)

Manager of the dubbing studio [Studio PDK](http://studiopdk.pl/). Founder, editor-and-chief, and webmaster of [Dubbingpedia.pl](https://dubbingpedia.pl/wiki/Strona_g%C5%82%C3%B3wna). Worked as project manager at the Polish anime distributor Anime Eden from 2014 until 2018.
Translator and audio engineer at Studio PDK. Previously worked at Studio Eurocom, IZ-Tekst and Studio Sonica.

[Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/dariusz.kosmowski) | [Linkedin](https://www.linkedin.com/in/dariusz-kosmowski/) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/@dubdaru)

Manager of the dubbing studio [Studio PDK](http://studiopdk.pl/). Founder, editor-and-chief, and webmaster of [Dubbingpedia.pl](https://dubbingpedia.pl/wiki/Strona_g%C5%82%C3%B3wna). Worked as project manager at the Polish anime distributor Anime Eden from 2014 until 2018.
Translator and audio engineer at Studio PDK. Previously worked at Studio Eurocom, IZ-Tekst and Studio Sonica.

[Twitter](http://www.twitter.com/LaloGarx) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/lalogarx/) | [Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/LaloGarx) | [Youtube](https://www.youtube.com/user/Eduardogaara)

**José Eduardo Garza Escudero** is a Mexican voice actor. He is known for being the Latin American Spanish voice of Josh Nichols in _Drake & Josh_, Elmo in _Sesame Street_ and Francis in _Malcolm in the Middle_.
He's the recurring dub voice of Josh Peck and Jonah Hill.

**Non-Anime Roles**:
* Kayn (League of Legends)
* Nightwing / Dick Grayson (Batman: Arkham Knight)
* Dirhael (Middle-Earth: Shadow of Mordor) 
* Delmont "Del" Walker (Gears of War 4)
* Josh Nichols (Drake & Josh)

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/dmpmutation)

**Shinji Ishihira** is a Japanese director, episode director and storyboard artist.
